lines.text: If you're reading this text me back!
Hello?
Hi there, you must be ÑŠ. Arrived at the station ABX-03
Let me get the lights in there...
There, lights should be on now
Sorry if your station looks like something from a horror movie haha
If you remember from your basic training, this is just a pilot program, so.. not a lot of budget.
You didn't sleep on your training, right?
Uh... Well you can already push a few buttons, and you somehow found your way to this station. That should be enough for this job anyway. I'll just walk you through then
This station is pretty basic. Maybe corpo will upgrade it if the programm takes off. Please tell me you can at least recall the name of it
...Sorry
How can you forget what you signed up for? It's "QUALITY ASSURANCE AND PERFORMANCE EVALUATION PROGRAM FOR HARDWARE APPLIANCES". Or QAPEPHA for short, rolls off the tongue
Just messing with you. I could never remember it myself. I just copypasted it, that's why it's all caps haha
Aaanyway, we inspect stuff here, like microwaves and toasters. Checking if their hardware at least turns on, or has any other abaritons
Abberrashon*
Abarations*
Abereitons?
Defects.
Speaking of which. A new package should arrive soon for you to inspect. Take it and scan it with the barcode scanner over there ->
Good, alright. You can lift up an average 7kg  oscilograph.
I wasn't trying to patronize you by the way, I have no idea what you even look like. Since apparently CCTVs are also expensive
Anyway, when you scan incoming parcels you should find a digital checklist that gets updated for each parcel. It'll tell you what are the next steps
I don't see any checklist?
Hey, sorry to interrupt but this is where the demo ends.
First off, thanks for spending your precious time on this unfinished "game"

As far as I'm concerned, I didn't enter the jam to win (not a cope). But rather to get practical experience developing with a new engine. As corny as it sounds I learned [i]quite a lot[/i] in these short 2 weeks
...Okay?

To be honest, I spent more time dealing with unexpected irl issues that I won't delve on here. I spent way too much learning the engine and drafting concepts than actually developing. But I'm happy to say there's some banger ideas I have for this project (not a cope)
Oh crap, I still have to test and upload the game. Gotta run!
